p: Among 15 commercially available benzoates, benzylbenzoate, n-pentybenzoate, and hexylbenzoate showed strongest contact toxicity against fire ants [ 68]. Hexylbenzoate is a naturally occurring compound, which is present in apricot, lingonberry, cowberry, feijoa, peach, sapodilla, Parmesan cheese, butter and black tea. Hexyl benzoate is used as a flavoring ingredient (PubChem CID: 23235, URL: https://pubchem.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/compound/Hexyl-benzoate). Since hexylbenzoate does not have Occupational Safety and Health Administration hazards and its risk to the environment is acceptable [ 74], it has been formulated as an emulsifiable concentrate and the evaluation of this formulation as a mound drench treatment is ongoing (Chen, unpublished data).
